speaker: KING EDWARD IV
text_entry: SCENE II. A field of battle near Barnet.

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
text_entry: Alarum and excursions. Enter KING EDWARD IV, bringing forth WARWICK wounded

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
text_entry: So, lie thou there: die thou, and die our fear;

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
text_entry: For Warwick was a bug that fear'd us all.

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
text_entry: Now, Montague, sit fast; I seek for thee,

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
text_entry: That Warwick's bones may keep thine company.

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
text_entry: Exit

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Ah, who is nigh? come to me, friend or foe,

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: And tell me who is victor, York or Warwick?

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Why ask I that? my mangled body shows,

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: My blood, my want of strength, my sick heart shows.

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: That I must yield my body to the earth

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: And, by my fall, the conquest to my foe.

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Thus yields the cedar to the axe's edge,

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Whose arms gave shelter to the princely eagle,

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Under whose shade the ramping lion slept,

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Whose top-branch overpeer'd Jove's spreading tree

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: And kept low shrubs from winter's powerful wind.

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: These eyes, that now are dimm'd with death's black veil,

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Have been as piercing as the mid-day sun,

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: To search the secret treasons of the world:

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: The wrinkles in my brows, now filled with blood,

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Were liken'd oft to kingly sepulchres;

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: For who lived king, but I could dig his grave?

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: And who durst mine when Warwick bent his brow?

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Lo, now my glory smear'd in dust and blood!

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: My parks, my walks, my manors that I had.

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Even now forsake me, and of all my lands

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Is nothing left me but my body's length.

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Why, what is pomp, rule, reign, but earth and dust?

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: And, live we how we can, yet die we must.

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Enter OXFORD and SOMERSET

speaker: SOMERSET
text_entry: Ah, Warwick, Warwick! wert thou as we are.

speaker: SOMERSET
text_entry: We might recover all our loss again;

speaker: SOMERSET
text_entry: The queen from France hath brought a puissant power:

speaker: SOMERSET
text_entry: Even now we heard the news: ah, could'st thou fly!

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Why, then I would not fly. Ah, Montague,

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: If thou be there, sweet brother, take my hand.

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: And with thy lips keep in my soul awhile!

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Thou lovest me not; for, brother, if thou didst,

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Thy tears would wash this cold congealed blood

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: That glues my lips and will not let me speak.

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Come quickly, Montague, or I am dead.

speaker: SOMERSET
text_entry: Ah, Warwick! Montague hath breathed his last;

speaker: SOMERSET
text_entry: And to the latest gasp cried out for Warwick,

speaker: SOMERSET
text_entry: And said 'Commend me to my valiant brother.'

speaker: SOMERSET
text_entry: And more he would have said, and more he spoke,

speaker: SOMERSET
text_entry: Which sounded like a clamour in a vault,

speaker: SOMERSET
text_entry: That mought not be distinguished; but at last

speaker: SOMERSET
text_entry: I well might hear, delivered with a groan,

speaker: SOMERSET
text_entry: 'O, farewell, Warwick!'

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Sweet rest his soul! Fly, lords, and save yourselves;

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: For Warwick bids you all farewell to meet in heaven.

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Dies

speaker: OXFORD
text_entry: Away, away, to meet the queen's great power!

speaker: OXFORD
text_entry: Here they bear away his body. Exeunt
